reviewText:
What a lovely film!! This is a story you can enjoy with your whole family. And though it touches on truly, challenging topics (death, health care hardships, financial unfairness) it does so respectfully and in a family friendly manner.

Walter, John Heard's character, is infinitely likable! The laughs are mostly comfortable and at times a much needed release from a difficult situation.

A true joy, Stealing Roses is a film about love, moments, and adventure told in a refreshingly relatable way. I loved it!

Stealing Roses is a hilarious look at sad state of our broken healthcare system.  Though filmed before Obama's fated heath care system more of benefit to insurance companies than the people, it still rings true.

I actually don't have an opinion onthe movie...I am very hard of hearing and always select movies with closed captioning...but couldn't get it work on this one...I wish it had...looks like it would have been okay.

seriously, I love all the actors - its not their fault - the script was just all CORNBALL!!
Cute but could not hold my attention even tho it is a movie for my demographic.
Health insurance SUCKS!!  Damn'd if you do and Damn'd if you don't!!
made me cry, very close to home
Funny and sad at the same time...loved this movie!

This was a very good movie, it's not an action movie, it's a drama and a suspenseful movie. And it's down to earth, something you can relate to. You probably know or known someone who went thru this. It's worth watching!
Pathetic acting. A comedy involved a woman dying of cancer. Ridiculous.
this is why every body gets a medicare card
